wiki.content:
"Minnie the Moocher" is a jazz song first recorded in 1931 by Cab Calloway and His Orchestra, selling over 1 million copies. "Minnie the Moocher" is most famous for its nonsensical ad libbed ("scat") lyrics. "Minnie the Moocher" was inducted into the Grammy Hall of Fame in 1999.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Minnie the Moocher" is a jazz song first recorded in 1931 by Cab Calloway and His Orchestra, selling over 1 million copies. "Minnie the Moocher" is most famous for its nonsensical ad libbed ("scat") lyrics. "Minnie the Moocher" was inducted into the Grammy Hall of Fame in 1999.

track.name: Minnie the Moocher
comments: Hi de hi de hi de ho!
FYI that wasn't the audience singing in response to Cab Calloway; it was his band.

A couple of nights back, I went back to the Blues Brothers movie, in which it was so nice to see Cab getting some proper respect. OK, he wasn't the greatest of big band leaders, but he was always fun and Minnie the Moocher deserves to be brought alive for a new generation.
I wish I knew more about the family from back then cause it appears the northerners didn't want much to do with the southerns.
Classic Cab; great showman. Great tune from the Cotton Club days.
reminds me of the blues brothers
...and all I can think of is Hugh Laurie singing this that one time as Bertie Wooster
This song was so unconventional for back then, with the crowd shouting the lyrics back and all, but its now one of the most recognizable, cherished jazz classics.
Cooool man,  I can dig it!!!
